factoid: Anna Mikháylovna touched Pierre's hand and said "Come."
Pierre went with Anna Mikháylovna to the bed where the sick man had been laid.
The sick man lay with his head propped high on pillows.
The sick man's hands were placed symmetrically on a green silk quilt with palms downward.
The count was gazing straight at Pierre.
The count's gaze had an unclear significance.
Pierre hesitated and glanced at Anna Mikháylovna for instructions.
Anna Mikháylovna signaled with her eyes and lips to send a kiss to the sick man's hand.
Pierre pressed his lips to the sick man's hand.
The sick man's hand did not move during the kiss.
The sick man's face did not move during the kiss.
Pierre looked again at Anna Mikháylovna for further instructions.
Anna Mikháylovna indicated a chair beside the bed.
Pierre obediently sat down in the chair.
Anna Mikháylovna nodded approvingly at Pierre.
Pierre adopted a pose similar to an Egyptian statue to appear small.
Pierre looked at the sick man.
The sick man still gazed at the spot where Pierre's face had been.
Anna Mikháylovna was aware of the importance of the last moments of the meeting between father and son.
The last moments lasted about two minutes.
The sick man's face began to twitch.
The sick man's mouth twitched to one side and made an indistinct hoarse sound.
Pierre realized his father was near death.
Anna Mikháylovna looked at the sick man's eyes and tried to guess his wants.
Anna Mikháylovna pointed to Pierre.
Anna Mikháylovna pointed to a drink.
Anna Mikháylovna whispered Prince Vasíli's name.
Anna Mikháylovna pointed to the quilt.
The sick man's eyes and face showed impatience.
The sick man looked at the servant at the head of the bed.
The servant whispered that the sick man wanted to turn to the other side.
The servant got up to turn the sick man's body toward the wall.
Pierre rose to help the servant.
While being turned, the sick man's arm fell back helplessly.
The sick man tried to pull his arm forward.
The sick man glanced at his arm, at Pierre's face, and smiled feebly.
Pierre felt a quiver and tears when seeing the smile.
The sick man was turned onto his side facing the wall and sighed.
Anna Mikháylovna said the sick man was dozing.
Anna Mikháylovna told Pierre and Anna to leave.
Pierre left the room.
Prince Vasíli and the eldest princess were sitting under a portrait of Catherine the Great and talking eagerly.
Prince Vasíli and the eldest princess became silent upon seeing Pierre and Anna.
Pierre thought the eldest princess hid something and whispered "I can't bear the sight of that woman."
Prince Vasíli told Anna that Catiche had tea served in the small drawing room.
Prince Vasíli told Anna to go and take something or she would not hold out.
Prince Vasíli gave Pierre a sympathetic squeeze below the shoulder.
Pierre accompanied Anna into the small drawing room.
The sick man was Pierre's father.
The servant stood constantly at the head of the bed.
The sick man's smile appeared feeble and piteous.
